title: Requirement 1
text: Patients must be able to book appointments with available doctors for specific time slots.

title: Requirement 2
text: An appointment is linked to exactly one patient, one doctor, and one clinic location.

title: Requirement 3
text: Appointments must capture the scheduled start time and planned duration in minutes.

title: Requirement 4
text: Cancellations must record the cancellation timestamp and the actor (patient or staff).

title: Requirement 5
text: Each patient visit is performed at a clinic room and may reference the originating appointment.

title: Requirement 6
text: Every visit is documented by exactly one clinician (doctor or nurse).

title: Requirement 7
text: During a visit, clinicians can record diagnoses and associate them with standardized codes.

title: Requirement 8
text: Visits may include multiple procedures, each with a code, description, and status (planned, completed).

title: Requirement 9
text: Vital signs (blood pressure, heart rate, temperature) must be timestamped and linked to the recording clinician.

title: Requirement 10
text: Laboratory orders belong to a visit, indicate the ordering clinician, and reference the patient.

title: Requirement 11
text: Each lab order can produce one or more lab results with value, unit, and observation timestamp.

title: Requirement 12
text: Prescriptions must specify the medication, dosage text, frequency, and the prescribing doctor.

title: Requirement 13
text: Every prescription is associated with the patient and optionally the originating visit.

title: Requirement 14
text: Medications have a generic name, form (tablet, liquid, etc.), and strength.

title: Requirement 15
text: Insurance policies are linked to patients and store payer, policy number, and coverage tier.

title: Requirement 16
text: Billing records must capture the visit, total amount due, payer, and payment status.

title: Requirement 17
text: Payments should record the amount, currency, payment method, and settlement date.

title: Requirement 18
text: Clinics are organized into departments; each department has a manager and one or more rooms.

title: Requirement 19
text: Rooms have identifiers, capacity, and availability status for scheduling.

title: Requirement 20
text: Schedules define available slots for clinicians and block overlapping bookings.

title: Requirement 21
text: A clinician's license ID must be stored and validated as a non-empty string.

title: Requirement 22
text: Contact information (email, phone) should be recorded for patients and clinicians.

title: Requirement 23
text: Appointments must record the reason for visit in free text.

title: Requirement 24
text: No appointment slot may be double-booked for the same clinician and start time.

title: Requirement 25
text: Every visit outcome must indicate whether the patient was discharged, referred, or admitted.

title: Requirement 26
text: Consent records link a patient to the consenting clinician, with date and scope.

title: Requirement 27
text: Laboratory results must reference the corresponding lab order and include the performing lab.

title: Requirement 28
text: Procedures performed during a visit should capture start/end timestamps.

title: Requirement 29
text: Each insurance policy should have an effective start and optional end date.

title: Requirement 30
text: Audit trails should store the actor and timestamp for scheduling actions.
